description: Replacing the rood of the building Carpenter Shed at Agassiz Research and Development Centre. The building does not have a functional roof and needs a new one. The scope of work includes removing the old roof, installing the new one, and ensuring that the structure is safe and solid to support future use.

full_summary:
# Roof Replacement for Agassiz Research and Development Centre - ITT

### Notice Information

| Category    | Information  |
|--------------|--------------|
| **Reference Number**   | cb-185-69013888          |
| **Announcement Number** | 01R11-25-085                        |
| **Solicitation Date**  | 2024-07-08                               |
| **Tender Closing Date**| 2024-07-23 12:00:00 |
| **Notice Type**       | Invitation to Qualify (ITT)                |
| **Procurement Method** | Competitive – Open Bidding                      |

### Summary

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites qualified bidders to submit a proposal for the roof replacement of Building 20 – Carpenter Shed at the Agassiz Research and Development Centre in Agassiz, British Columbia. The scope of work includes the removal of the existing metal roof, underlay, gutters, flashing, and cupolas, replacement of damaged or missing sheathing, and installation of a new underlay, interlocking metal roofing, flashing, gutters, and downspouts. The project must be completed by December 1, 2024.

### Basis of selection

A two-phase selection process will be employed. Phase One bids will only cover the qualifications and experience of the bidder, while Phase Two bids will include pricing. A combination of the Phase One and Phase Two submissions constitutes the final bid.

### Procurement Preamble

The contracting authority is responsible for ensuring that procurement activities comply with the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.

### Delivery Information

The project will be delivered within the region of British Columbia. Canada is not responsible for the information found on websites of third parties and will not assume any liabilities.

### Indigenous Procurement Opportunity

Indigenous suppliers are encouraged to participate in this procurement opportunity. Having a business profile in the Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) will increase visibility and may provide additional business opportunities.

### How to Obtain Documentation

Documentation may be accessed through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [YOUR FCC-CGC ID HERE](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities).

### Contract Duration

The estimated contract duration is 9 months.

Contact for Information
Desta Kissack 
desta.kissack@agr.gc.ca 
(204) 583-8127 
4-303 Main Street 
Winn
